00087       typedef struct MEMORY_NODE
00088       {
00089             PTR pBlock;
00090             struct MEMORY_NODE *next, *prev;
00091             UINT8 *pCode;
00092             UINT32 uiSize;
00093       }MEMORY_NODE;

00095       MEMORY_NODE  *gpMemoryHead = NULL;
00096       MEMORY_NODE  *gpMemoryTail = NULL;
00097       UINT32                        guiMemoryNodes = 0;
00098       UINT32                        guiTotalMemoryNodes = 0;

00102 // debug variable for total memory currently allocated

00104 UINT32  guiMemAlloced = 0;
00105 UINT32  guiMemFreed = 0;

00107 BOOLEAN fMemManagerInit = FALSE;

00137 BOOLEAN InitializeMemoryManager( void )
00138 {
00139       // Register the memory manager with the debugger
00140       RegisterDebugTopic(TOPIC_MEMORY_MANAGER, "Memory Manager");
00141       MemDebugCounter = 0;
00142       guiMemTotal = 0;
00143       guiMemAlloced = 0;
00144       guiMemFreed = 0;
00145       fMemManagerInit = TRUE;
00146 
00147       #ifdef EXTREME_MEMORY_DEBUGGING
00148             gpMemoryHead = NULL;
00149             gpMemoryTail = NULL;
00150             guiMemoryNodes = 0;
00151             guiTotalMemoryNodes = 0;
00152       #endif
00153 
00154       return(TRUE);
00155 }

00190 void ShutdownMemoryManager( void )
00191 {
00192       if ( MemDebugCounter != 0 )
00193       {
00194             DbgMessage( TOPIC_MEMORY_MANAGER, DBG_LEVEL_0, String(" "));
00195             DbgMessage( TOPIC_MEMORY_MANAGER, DBG_LEVEL_0, String("***** WARNING - WARNING - WARNING *****"));
00196             DbgMessage( TOPIC_MEMORY_MANAGER, DBG_LEVEL_0, String("***** WARNING - WARNING - WARNING *****"));
00197             DbgMessage( TOPIC_MEMORY_MANAGER, DBG_LEVEL_0, String("***** WARNING - WARNING - WARNING *****"));
00198             DbgMessage( TOPIC_MEMORY_MANAGER, DBG_LEVEL_0, String(" "));
00199             DbgMessage( TOPIC_MEMORY_MANAGER, DBG_LEVEL_0, String("  >>>>> MEMORY LEAK DETECTED!!! <<<<<  "));
00200             DbgMessage( TOPIC_MEMORY_MANAGER, DBG_LEVEL_0, String("%d memory blocks still allocated", MemDebugCounter ));
00201             DbgMessage( TOPIC_MEMORY_MANAGER, DBG_LEVEL_0, String("%d bytes memory total STILL allocated", guiMemTotal ));
00202             DbgMessage( TOPIC_MEMORY_MANAGER, DBG_LEVEL_0, String("%d bytes memory total was allocated", guiMemAlloced));
00203             DbgMessage( TOPIC_MEMORY_MANAGER, DBG_LEVEL_0, String("%d bytes memory total was freed", guiMemFreed));
00204 
00205             DbgMessage( TOPIC_MEMORY_MANAGER, DBG_LEVEL_0, String(" "));
00206             DbgMessage( TOPIC_MEMORY_MANAGER, DBG_LEVEL_0, String("***** WARNING - WARNING - WARNING *****"));
00207             DbgMessage( TOPIC_MEMORY_MANAGER, DBG_LEVEL_0, String("***** WARNING - WARNING - WARNING *****"));
00208             DbgMessage( TOPIC_MEMORY_MANAGER, DBG_LEVEL_0, String("***** WARNING - WARNING - WARNING *****"));
00209             DbgMessage( TOPIC_MEMORY_MANAGER, DBG_LEVEL_0, String(" "));
00210 
00211             #ifndef EXTREME_MEMORY_DEBUGGING
00212                   #ifdef JA2BETAVERSION
00213                   {
00214                         FILE *fp;
00215                         fp = fopen( "MemLeakInfo.txt", "a" );
00216                         if( fp )
00217                         {
00218                               fprintf( fp, "\n\n" );
00219                               fprintf( fp, ">>>>> MEMORY LEAK DETECTED!!! <<<<<\n" );
00220                               fprintf( fp, "  %d bytes memory total was allocated\n", guiMemAlloced );
00221                               fprintf( fp, "- %d bytes memory total was freed\n", guiMemFreed );
00222                               fprintf( fp, "_______________________________________________\n" );
00223                               fprintf( fp, "%d bytes memory total STILL allocated\n", guiMemTotal );
00224                               fprintf( fp, "%d memory blocks still allocated\n", MemDebugCounter );
00225                               fprintf( fp, "guiScreenExitedFrom = %S\n", gzJA2ScreenNames[ gMsgBox.uiExitScreen ] );
00226                               fprintf( fp, "\n\n" );
00227                         }
00228                         fclose( fp );
00229                   }
00230                   #endif
00231             #endif
00232       }
00233 
00234 
00235       UnRegisterDebugTopic( TOPIC_MEMORY_MANAGER, "Memory Manager Un-initialized" );
00236 
00237       fMemManagerInit = FALSE;
00238 }

00241 #ifdef _DEBUG
00242 
00243 PTR MemAllocReal( UINT32 uiSize, const char *pcFile, INT32 iLine )
00244 {
00245       PTR   ptr;
00246 
00247       if( !uiSize )
00248       {
00249             return NULL;
00250       }
00251 
00252       if ( !fMemManagerInit )
00253     DbgMessage( TOPIC_MEMORY_MANAGER, DBG_LEVEL_0, String("MemAlloc: Warning -- Memory manager not initialized -- Line %d in %s", iLine, pcFile) );
00254 
00255 
00256       ptr = _malloc_dbg( uiSize, _NORMAL_BLOCK, pcFile, iLine );
00257   if (ptr != NULL)
00258   {
00259             guiMemTotal   += uiSize;
00260             guiMemAlloced += uiSize;
00261             MemDebugCounter++;
00262   }
00263   else
00264       {
00265     DbgMessage( TOPIC_MEMORY_MANAGER, DBG_LEVEL_0, String("MemAlloc failed: %d bytes (line %d file %s)", uiSize, iLine, pcFile) );
00266       }
00267 
00268 #ifdef DEBUG_MEM_LEAKS
00269   DbgMessage( TOPIC_MEMORY_MANAGER, DBG_LEVEL_1, String("MemAlloc %p: %d bytes (line %d file %s)", ptr, uiSize, iLine, pcFile) );
00270 #endif
00271 
00272       return( ptr );
00273 }
00274 
00275 
00276 void MemFreeReal( PTR ptr, const char *pcFile, INT32 iLine )
00277 {
00278       UINT32 uiSize;
00279 
00280       if ( !fMemManagerInit )
00281     DbgMessage( TOPIC_MEMORY_MANAGER, DBG_LEVEL_0, String("MemFree: Warning -- Memory manager not initialized -- Line %d in %s", iLine, pcFile) );
00282 
00283   if (ptr != NULL)
00284   {
00285             uiSize = _msize(ptr);
00286             guiMemTotal -= uiSize;
00287             guiMemFreed += uiSize;
00288             _free_dbg( ptr, _NORMAL_BLOCK );
00289 
00290 #ifdef DEBUG_MEM_LEAKS
00291         DbgMessage( TOPIC_MEMORY_MANAGER, DBG_LEVEL_1, String("MemFree  %p: %d bytes (line %d file %s)", ptr, uiSize, iLine, pcFile) );
00292 #endif
00293   }
00294   else
00295   {
00296     DbgMessage( TOPIC_MEMORY_MANAGER, DBG_LEVEL_0, String("MemFree ERROR: NULL ptr received (line %d file %s)", iLine, pcFile) );
00297   }
00298 
00299   // count even a NULL ptr as a MemFree, not because it's really a memory leak, but because it is still an error of some
00300   // sort (nobody should ever be freeing NULL pointers), and this will help in tracking it down if the above DbgMessage
00301   // is not noticed.
00302   MemDebugCounter--;
00303 }
00304 
00305 
00306 PTR MemReallocReal( PTR ptr, UINT32 uiSize, const char *pcFile, INT32 iLine )
00307 {
00308       PTR   ptrNew;
00309       UINT32 uiOldSize;
00310 
00311 
00312       if ( !fMemManagerInit )
00313     DbgMessage( TOPIC_MEMORY_MANAGER, DBG_LEVEL_0, String("MemRealloc: Warning -- Memory manager not initialized -- Line %d in %s", iLine, pcFile) );
00314 
00315   if(ptr != NULL)
00316       {
00317             uiOldSize = _msize(ptr);
00318             guiMemTotal -= uiOldSize;
00319             guiMemFreed += uiOldSize;
00320         MemDebugCounter--;
00321       }
00322 
00323       // Note that the ptr changes to ptrNew...
00324       ptrNew = _realloc_dbg( ptr, uiSize, _NORMAL_BLOCK, pcFile, iLine );
00325   if (ptrNew == NULL)
00326   {
00327             DbgMessage( TOPIC_MEMORY_MANAGER, DBG_LEVEL_0, String("MemReAlloc failed: ptr %d, %d -> %d bytes (line %d file %s)", ptr, uiOldSize, uiSize, iLine, pcFile) );
00328             if ( uiSize != 0 )
00329             {
00330                   // ptr is left untouched, so undo the math above
00331                   guiMemTotal += uiOldSize;
00332                   guiMemFreed -= uiOldSize;
00333                   MemDebugCounter++;
00334             }
00335   }
00336   else
00337   {
00338 #ifdef DEBUG_MEM_LEAKS
00339       DbgMessage( TOPIC_MEMORY_MANAGER, DBG_LEVEL_1, String("MemRealloc %p: Resizing %d bytes to %d bytes (line %d file %s) - New ptr %p", ptr, uiOldSize, uiSize, iLine, pcFile, ptrNew ) );
00340 #endif
00341 
00342             guiMemTotal   += uiSize;
00343             guiMemAlloced += uiSize;
00344             MemDebugCounter++;
00345   }
00346 
00347       return( ptrNew );
00348 }
00349 
00350 #endif
00351 
00352 
00353 PTR MemAllocLocked( UINT32 uiSize )
00354 {
00355       PTR   ptr;
00356 
00357       if ( !fMemManagerInit )
00358     DbgMessage( TOPIC_MEMORY_MANAGER, DBG_LEVEL_0, String("MemAllocLocked: Warning -- Memory manager not initialized!!! ") );
00359 
00360       
00361       ptr = VirtualAlloc( NULL, uiSize, MEM_COMMIT, PAGE_READWRITE );
00362 
00363       if ( ptr )
00364       {
00365     VirtualLock( ptr, uiSize );
00366 
00367             guiMemTotal   += uiSize;
00368             guiMemAlloced += uiSize;
00369             MemDebugCounter++;
00370   }
00371   else
00372       {
00373     DbgMessage( TOPIC_MEMORY_MANAGER, DBG_LEVEL_0, String("MemAllocLocked failed: %d bytes", uiSize) );
00374       }
00375 
00376 #ifdef DEBUG_MEM_LEAKS
00377   DbgMessage( TOPIC_MEMORY_MANAGER, DBG_LEVEL_1, String("MemAllocLocked %p: %d bytes", ptr, uiSize) );
00378 #endif
00379 
00380       return( ptr );
00381 }
00382 
00383 
00384 void MemFreeLocked( PTR ptr, UINT32 uiSize )
00385 {
00386       if ( !fMemManagerInit )
00387     DbgMessage( TOPIC_MEMORY_MANAGER, DBG_LEVEL_0, String("MemFreeLocked: Warning -- Memory manager not initialized!!! ") );
00388 
00389 
00390   if (ptr != NULL)
00391   {
00392         VirtualUnlock( ptr, uiSize );
00393         VirtualFree( ptr, uiSize, MEM_RELEASE );
00394 
00395             guiMemTotal -= uiSize;
00396             guiMemFreed += uiSize;
00397   }
00398   else
00399   {
00400     DbgMessage( TOPIC_MEMORY_MANAGER, DBG_LEVEL_0, String("MemFreeLocked ERROR: NULL ptr received, size %d", uiSize) );
00401   }
00402 
00403   // count even a NULL ptr as a MemFree, not because it's really a memory leak, but because it is still an error of some
00404   // sort (nobody should ever be freeing NULL pointers), and this will help in tracking it down if the above DbgMessage
00405   // is not noticed.
00406   MemDebugCounter--;
00407 
00408 #ifdef DEBUG_MEM_LEAKS
00409   DbgMessage( TOPIC_MEMORY_MANAGER, DBG_LEVEL_1, String("MemFreeLocked  %p", ptr) );
00410 #endif
00411 }

00418 //          
00419 //

00423 //
00424 //          ??sep96:HJH       -> modified for use by Wizardry

00427 
00428 UINT32 MemGetFree( void )
00429 {
00430       MEMORYSTATUS ms;
00431 
00432       ms.dwLength = sizeof(MEMORYSTATUS);
00433       GlobalMemoryStatus( &ms );
00434 
00435       return( ms.dwAvailPhys );
00436 }

00459 
00460       return( ms.dwTotalPhys );

00492 #ifdef EXTREME_MEMORY_DEBUGGING
00493 
00494 PTR MemAllocXDebug( UINT32 size, const char *szCodeString, INT32 iLineNum, void *pSpecial )
00495 {
00496       PTR   ptr;
00497       UINT16 usLength;
00498       UINT8 str[70];
00499       UINT8 *pStr;
00500 
00501       if( !size )
00502       {
00503             return NULL;
00504       }
00505 
00506       if( !pSpecial  )
00507       {
00508             ptr = malloc( size );
00509       }
00510       else
00511       {
00512             ptr = pSpecial;
00513       }
00514 
00515   if( ptr )
00516   {
00517             // Set into video object list
00518             if( gpMemoryHead )
00519             { //Add node after tail
00520                   gpMemoryTail->next = (MEMORY_NODE*)malloc( sizeof( MEMORY_NODE ) );
00521                   Assert( gpMemoryTail->next ); //out of memory?
00522                   gpMemoryTail->next->prev = gpMemoryTail;
00523                   gpMemoryTail->next->next = NULL;
00524                   gpMemoryTail = gpMemoryTail->next;
00525             }
00526             else
00527             { //new list
00528                   gpMemoryHead = (MEMORY_NODE*)malloc( sizeof( MEMORY_NODE ) );
00529                   Assert( gpMemoryHead ); //out of memory?
00530                   gpMemoryHead->prev = gpMemoryHead->next = NULL;
00531                   gpMemoryTail = gpMemoryHead;
00532             }
00533 
00534             //record the code location of the calling creating function.
00535             pStr = strrchr( szCodeString, '\\' );
00536             pStr++;
00537             sprintf( str, "%s -- line(%d)", pStr, iLineNum );
00538             usLength = strlen( str ) + 1;
00539             gpMemoryTail->pCode = (UINT8*)malloc( usLength );
00540             memset( gpMemoryTail->pCode, 0, usLength );
00541             strcpy( gpMemoryTail->pCode, str );
00542 
00543             //record the size
00544             gpMemoryTail->uiSize = size;
00545 
00546             //Set the hVObject into the node.
00547             gpMemoryTail->pBlock = ptr;
00548 
00549             guiMemoryNodes++;
00550             guiTotalMemoryNodes++;
00551       }
00552       return( ptr );
00553 }
00554 
00555 void MemFreeXDebug( PTR ptr, const char *szCodeString, INT32 iLineNum, void *pSpecial )
00556 {
00557       MEMORY_NODE *curr;
00558 
00559   if( ptr )
00560   {
00561             curr = gpMemoryHead;
00562             while( curr )
00563             {
00564                   if( curr->pBlock == ptr )
00565                   { //Found the node, so detach it and delete it.
00566 
00567                         if( !pSpecial )
00568                         {
00569                               free( ptr );
00570                         }
00571 
00572                         if( curr == gpMemoryHead )
00573                         { //Advance the head, because we are going to remove the head node.
00574                               gpMemoryHead = gpMemoryHead->next;
00575                         }
00576                         if( curr == gpMemoryTail )
00577                         { //Back up the tail, because we are going to remove the tail node.
00578                               gpMemoryTail = gpMemoryTail->prev;
00579                         }
00580                         //Detach the node from the vobject list
00581                         if( curr->next )
00582                         { //Make the prev node point to the next
00583                               curr->next->prev = curr->prev;
00584                         }
00585                         if( curr->prev )
00586                         { //Make the next node point to the prev
00587                               curr->prev->next = curr->next;
00588                         }
00589                         //The node is now detached.  Now deallocate it.
00590                         free( curr );
00591                         curr = NULL;
00592                         guiMemoryNodes--;
00593                         return;
00594                   }
00595                   curr = curr->next;
00596             }
00597   }
00598 }
00599 
00600 PTR   MemReallocXDebug( PTR ptr, UINT32 size, const char *szCodeString, INT32 iLineNum, void *pSpecial )
00601 {
00602       MEMORY_NODE *curr;
00603       PTR   ptrNew;
00604       UINT16 usLength;
00605       UINT8 str[70];
00606       UINT8 *pStr;
00607 
00608       if( !ptr && size )
00609       {
00610             return MemAllocXDebug( size, szCodeString, iLineNum, pSpecial );
00611       }
00612 
00613       curr = gpMemoryHead;
00614       while( curr )
00615       {
00616             if( curr->pBlock == ptr )
00617             {
00618                   // Note that the ptr changes to ptrNew...
00619                   if( !pSpecial )
00620                   {
00621                         ptrNew = realloc( ptr, size );
00622                   }
00623                   else
00624                   {
00625                         ptrNew = pSpecial;
00626                   }
00627 
00628                   if( ptrNew )
00629                   {
00630                         curr->pBlock = ptrNew;
00631                         curr->uiSize = size;
00632 
00633                         free( curr->pCode );
00634 
00635                         //record the code location of the calling creating function.
00636                         pStr = strrchr( szCodeString, '\\' );
00637                         pStr++;
00638                         sprintf( str, "%s -- line(%d)", pStr, iLineNum );
00639                         usLength = strlen( str ) + 1;
00640                         curr->pCode = (UINT8*)malloc( usLength );
00641                         memset( curr->pCode, 0, usLength );
00642                         strcpy( curr->pCode, str );
00643                   }
00644                   else
00645                   {
00646                         ptr = ptr;
00647                   }
00648                   return ptrNew;
00649             }
00650             curr = curr->next;
00651       }
00652       return 0;
00653 }
00654 
00655 typedef struct DUMPFILENAME
00656 {
00657       UINT8 str[70];
00658 }DUMPFILENAME;
00659 
00660 void DumpMemoryInfoIntoFile( UINT8 *filename, BOOLEAN fAppend )
00661 {
00662       MEMORY_NODE *curr;
00663       FILE *fp;
00664       DUMPFILENAME *pCode;
00665       UINT32 *puiCounter, *puiSize;
00666       UINT8 tempCode[ 70 ];
00667       UINT32 i, uiUniqueID, uiTotalKbWasted = 0, uiBytesRemainder = 0;
00668       BOOLEAN fFound;
00669 
00670       if( fAppend )
00671       {
00672             fp = fopen( filename, "a" );
00673       }
00674       else
00675       {
00676             fp = fopen( filename, "w" );
00677       }
00678       Assert( fp );
00679 
00680       if( !guiMemoryNodes )
00681       {
00682             fprintf( fp, "NO MEMORY LEAKS DETECTED!  CONGRATULATIONS!\n" );
00683             fclose( fp );
00684             return;
00685       }
00686 
00687       //Allocate enough strings and counters for each node.
00688       pCode = (DUMPFILENAME*)malloc( sizeof( DUMPFILENAME ) * guiMemoryNodes );
00689       memset( pCode, 0, sizeof( DUMPFILENAME ) * guiMemoryNodes );
00690       puiSize = (UINT32*)malloc( 4 * guiMemoryNodes );
00691       memset( puiSize, 0, 4 * guiMemoryNodes );
00692       puiCounter = (UINT32*)malloc( 4 * guiMemoryNodes );
00693       memset( puiCounter, 0, 4 * guiMemoryNodes );
00694 
00695       //Loop through the list and record every unique filename and count them
00696       uiUniqueID = 0;
00697       curr = gpMemoryHead;
00698       while( curr )
00699       {
00700             strcpy( tempCode, curr->pCode );
00701             fFound = FALSE;
00702             for( i = 0; i < uiUniqueID; i++ )
00703             {
00704                   if( !_stricmp( tempCode, pCode[i].str ) )
00705                   { //same string
00706                         fFound = TRUE;
00707                         (puiCounter[ i ])++;
00708                         (puiSize[ i ]) += curr->uiSize;
00709                         break;
00710                   }
00711             }
00712             if( !fFound )
00713             {
00714                   strcpy( pCode[i].str, tempCode );
00715                   (puiSize[ i ]) += curr->uiSize;
00716                   (puiCounter[ i ])++;
00717                   uiUniqueID++;
00718             }
00719             curr = curr->next;
00720       }
00721 
00722       //Now dump the info.
00723       fprintf( fp, "--------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n" );
00724       fprintf( fp, "%d unique memory allocation locations exist in %d memory nodes\n", uiUniqueID, guiMemoryNodes );
00725       fprintf( fp, "--------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n" );
00726       for( i = 0; i < uiUniqueID; i++ )
00727       {
00728             fprintf( fp, "%d occurrences of %s (total size %d bytes)\n", puiCounter[i], pCode[i].str, puiSize[i] );
00729             uiBytesRemainder += puiSize[i];
00730             if( uiBytesRemainder >= 1024 )
00731             {
00732                   uiTotalKbWasted += uiBytesRemainder/1024;
00733                   uiBytesRemainder %= 1024;
00734             }
00735       }
00736       fprintf( fp, "--------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n" );
00737       fprintf( fp, "%dKB of memory total wasn't cleaned up!\n", uiTotalKbWasted );
00738       fprintf( fp, "--------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n" );
00739 
00740       fclose( fp );
00741 
00742       //Free all memory associated with this operation.
00743       free( pCode );
00744       free( puiCounter );
00745       free( puiSize );
00746 }
00747 
00748 BOOLEAN _AddAndRecordMemAlloc( UINT32 size, UINT32 uiLineNum, UINT8 *pSourceFile )
00749 {
00750       return 0;
00751 }
00752 
00753 #endif
